# mcp-chat

RowTranslations.originContent: Open Source Generic MCP Client for testing & evaluating mcp servers and agents
RowTranslations.translatedContent: Cliente MCP gen√©rico de c√≥digo abierto para probar y evaluar servidores y agentes MCP

Content:
## Quickstart

Make sure that you have `ANTHROPIC_API_KEY` exported in your environment or in a .env file in the root of the project. You can get an API key by signing up at the [Anthropic Console keys page](https://console.anthropic.com/settings/keys).

Simple use case that spawns an interactive chat prompt with the filesystem MCP server from CLI:
Translation:
## Inicio r√°pido

Aseg√∫rate de tener `ANTHROPIC_API_KEY` exportada en tu entorno o en un archivo .env en la ra√≠z del proyecto. Puedes obtener una clave API registr√°ndote en la [p√°gina de claves del Consola Anthropic](https://console.anthropic.com/settings/keys).

Caso de uso simple que inicia un mensaje de chat interactivo con el servidor MCP del sistema de archivos desde la CLI:

RowTranslations.originContent: Make sure that you have `ANTHROPIC_API_KEY` exported in your environment or in a .env file in the root of the project. You can get an API key by signing up at the [Anthropic Console keys page](https://console.anthropic.com/settings/keys).
RowTranslations.translatedContent: Aseg√∫rate de tener `ANTHROPIC_API_KEY` exportada en tu entorno o en un archivo .env en la ra√≠z del proyecto. Puedes obtener una clave API registr√°ndote en la [p√°gina de claves del Consola Anthropic](https://console.anthropic.com/settings/keys).

RowTranslations.originContent: Simple use case that spawns an interactive chat prompt with the filesystem MCP server from CLI:
RowTranslations.translatedContent: Caso de uso simple que inicia un mensaje de chat interactivo con el servidor MCP del sistema de archivos desde la CLI:

Content:
```shell
npx mcp-chat --server "npx -y @modelcontextprotocol/server-filesystem /Users/$USER/Desktop"
```
Translation:
```shell
npx mcp-chat --server "npx -y @modelcontextprotocol/server-filesystem /Users/$USER/Desktop"
```

Content:
This will open up a chat prompt that you can use to interact with the servers and chat with an LLM.

## Config

You can also just specify your claude_desktop_config.json (Mac):
Translation:
Esto abrir√° un cuadro de chat que puedes usar para interactuar con los servidores y chatear con un LLM.

## Configuraci√≥n

Tambi√©n puedes simplemente especificar tu archivo claude_desktop_config.json (Mac):

Content:
```shell
npx mcp-chat --config "~/Library/Application Support/Claude/claude_desktop_config.json"
```
Translation:
```shell
npx mcp-chat --config "~/Library/Application Support/Claude/claude_desktop_config.json"
```

Content: Or (Windows):
Translation: O (Windows):

Content:
```shell
npx mcp-chat --config "%APPDATA%\Claude\claude_desktop_config.json"
```
Translation:
```shell
npx mcp-chat --config "%APPDATA%\Claude\claude_desktop_config.json"
```

Content:
## Web mode

https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/b7e8a648-8084-4955-8cdf-fc6eb141572e

You can also run mcp-chat in web mode by specifying the `--web` flag (make sure to have `ANTHROPIC_API_KEY` exported in your environment):
Translation:
## Web mode

https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/b7e8a648-8084-4955-8cdf-fc6eb141572e

You can also run mcp-chat in web mode by specifying the `--web` flag (make sure to have `ANTHROPIC_API_KEY` exported in your environment):

Content:
```shell
npx mcp-chat --web
```
Translation:
```shell
npx mcp-chat --web
```

Content:
In web mode, you can start new chats, send messages to the model, and dynamically configure the mcp servers via the UI - no need to specify on the command line. In addition, chats created via the Web UI are saved to ~/.mcpchats/chats just like chats created via the CLI.

## Features

- [x] Run via CLI in interactive mode or directly pass prompts with `-p`
- [x] Web mode to chat with models via a web interface `--web`
- [x] Connect to any MCP server (JS, Python, Docker) in production or during development
- [x] Choose between models with `-m`
- [x] Customize system prompt with `--system`
- [x] Saves chat history with settings in `~/.mcpchat/chats` including web chats
- [x] Save and restore commands in `~/.mcpchat/history`
- [x] View tool call output and arguments directly in chat to help debug mcp servers

## CLI Usage

Run prompts via CLI with the `-p` flag:
Translation:
En modo web, puedes iniciar nuevos chats, enviar mensajes al modelo y configurar din√°micamente los servidores mcp a trav√©s de la interfaz de usuario - no es necesario especificarlo en la l√≠nea de comandos. Adem√°s, los chats creados mediante la interfaz web se guardan en ~/.mcpchats/chats igual que los chats creados mediante la CLI.

## Caracter√≠sticas

- [x] Ejecutar v√≠a CLI en modo interactivo o pasar directamente indicaciones con `-p`
- [x] Modo web para chatear con modelos mediante una interfaz web `--web`
- [x] Conectarse a cualquier servidor MCP (JS, Python, Docker) en producci√≥n o durante el desarrollo
- [x] Elegir entre modelos con `-m`
- [x] Personalizar la indicaci√≥n del sistema con `--system`
- [x] Guarda el historial de chat con configuraciones en `~/.mcpchat/chats` incluyendo chats web
- [x] Guardar y restaurar comandos en `~/.mcpchat/history`
- [x] Ver la salida de llamadas a herramientas y argumentos directamente en el chat para ayudar a depurar servidores mcp

## Uso de la CLI

Ejecuta indicaciones v√≠a CLI con la bandera `-p`:

Content:
```shell
npx mcp-chat --server "npx mcp-server-kubernetes" -p "List the pods in the default namespace"
```
Translation:
```shell
npx mcp-chat --server "npx mcp-server-kubernetes" -p "List the pods in the default namespace"
```

Content:
This runs the prompt with the kubenertes mcp-server & exits after the response is received on stdout.

Choose a model to chat with via CLI with the `-m` flag:
Translation:
Esto ejecuta el prompt con el servidor mcp de Kubernetes y sale despu√©s de recibir la respuesta en stdout.

Elija un modelo para chatear a trav√©s de la CLI con la bandera `-m`:

Content:
```shell
npx mcp-chat --server "npx mcp-server-kubernetes" -m "claude-3.5"
```
Translation:
```shell
npx mcp-chat --server "npx mcp-server-kubernetes" -m "claude-3.5"
```

Content:
Uses the model `claude-3.5` to chat with. Note that currently only Anthropic models are supported.

Custom system prompt:

`--system` flag can be used to specify a system prompt:
Translation:
Utiliza el modelo `claude-3.5` para chatear. Tenga en cuenta que actualmente solo se admiten modelos de Anthropic.

El indicador del sistema personalizado:

La bandera `--system` se puede usar para especificar un indicador del sistema:

Content:
```shell
npx mcp-chat --system "Explain the output to the user in pirate speak." --server "npx mcp-server-kubernetes" -p "List the pods in the default namespace"
```
Translation:
```shell
npx mcp-chat --system "Explain the output to the user in pirate speak." --server "npx mcp-server-kubernetes" -p "List the pods in the default namespace"
```

Content:
## ENV vars

Mcp-chat supports passing through env vars to mcp servers. This is not standardized in the mcp spec though and other clients may not do this with dynamic env var values - read more [here](https://github.com/Flux159/mcp-server-kubernetes/issues/148#issuecomment-2950181666) about standard stdio mcp clients.
Translation:
## Variables de entorno

Mcp-chat soporta pasar variables de entorno a los servidores mcp. Sin embargo, esto no est√° estandarizado en la especificaci√≥n mcp y otros clientes pueden no hacerlo con valores din√°micos de variables de entorno; lee m√°s [aqu√≠](https://github.com/Flux159/mcp-server-kubernetes/issues/148#issuecomment-2950181666) sobre clientes est√°ndar stdio mcp.

Content:
```shell
KUBECONFIG="~/.kube/config" npx mcp-chat --server "npx mcp-server-kubernetes"
```
Translation:
```shell
KUBECONFIG="~/.kube/config" npx mcp-chat --server "npx mcp-server-kubernetes"
```

Content:
## For developers of mcp-servers

You can pass in a local build of a python or node mcp-server to test it out with mcp-chat:

Node JS:
Translation:
## Para desarrolladores de mcp-servers

Puedes pasar una compilaci√≥n local de un mcp-server en python o node para probarlo con mcp-chat:

Node JS:

Content:
```shell
# Directly executing built script
npx mcp-chat --server "/path/to/mcp-server-kubernetes/dist/index.js"
# Using node / bun
npx mcp-chat --server "node /path/to/mcp-server-kubernetes/dist/index.js"
```
Translation:
```shell
# Directly executing built script
npx mcp-chat --server "/path/to/mcp-server-kubernetes/dist/index.js"
# Using node / bun
npx mcp-chat --server "node /path/to/mcp-server-kubernetes/dist/index.js"
```

Content: Python:
Translation: Python:

Content:
```shell
# Python: Using uv
npx mcp-chat --server "uv --directory /path/to/mcp-server-weather/ run weather.py"
# Using python / python3 - make sure to run in venv or install deps globally
npx mcp-chat --server "/path/to/mcp-server-weather/weather.py"
```
Translation:
```shell
# Python: Using uv
npx mcp-chat --server "uv --directory /path/to/mcp-server-weather/ run weather.py"
# Using python / python3 - make sure to run in venv or install deps globally
npx mcp-chat --server "/path/to/mcp-server-weather/weather.py"
```

Content:
## Development

Install dependencies & run the CLI:
Translation:
## Desarrollo

Instale las dependencias y ejecute la CLI:

Content:
```shell
git clone https://github.com/Flux159/mcp-chat
bun install
bun run dev
```
Translation:
```shell
git clone https://github.com/Flux159/mcp-chat
bun install
bun run dev
```

Content: To develop mcp-chat while connecting to an mcp-server, make a build & run the CLI with the server flag:
Translation: Para desarrollar mcp-chat mientras se conecta a un mcp-server, crea una compilaci√≥n y ejecuta la CLI con la bandera del servidor:

Content:
```shell
npm run build && node dist/index.js --server "npx mcp-server-kubernetes" -p "List the pods in the default namespace"
```
Translation:
```shell
npm run build && node dist/index.js --server "npx mcp-server-kubernetes" -p "List the pods in the default namespace"
```

Translation: Pruebas:

```shell

```

```shell

```

```shell

```
Translation:
```shell

```

Content: Publishing:
Translation: Publicaci√≥n:

```shell

```
Translation:
```shell

```

Translation: Publicando Docker:

```shell

```


Content: ### Project Structure
Translation: ### Estructura del Proyecto

Content:

```
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ src/

‚îÇ   ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ constants.ts        # Default constants
```

Content:
## Publishing new release

Go to the [releases](https://github.com/Flux159/mcp-chat/releases) page, click on "Draft New Release", click "Choose a tag" and create a new tag by typing out a new version number using "v{major}.{minor}.{patch}" semver format. Then, write a release title "Release v{major}.{minor}.{patch}" and description / changelog if necessary and click "Publish Release".

This will create a new tag which will trigger a new release build via the cd.yml workflow. Once successful, the new release will be published to npm. Note that there is no need to update the package.json version manually, as the workflow will automatically update the version number in the package.json file & push a commit to main.

## License

[MIT License](https://github.com/Flux159/mcp-chat/blob/main/LICENSE)
Translation:
## Publicaci√≥n de una nueva versi√≥n

Ve a la p√°gina de [releases](https://github.com/Flux159/mcp-chat/releases), haz clic en "Draft New Release", selecciona "Choose a tag" y crea una nueva etiqueta escribiendo un nuevo n√∫mero de versi√≥n usando el formato semver "v{major}.{minor}.{patch}". Luego, escribe un t√≠tulo para la versi√≥n "Release v{major}.{minor}.{patch}" y una descripci√≥n / registro de cambios si es necesario y haz clic en "Publish Release".

Esto crear√° una nueva etiqueta que activar√° una nueva compilaci√≥n de lanzamiento v√≠a el flujo de trabajo cd.yml. Una vez exitoso, la nueva versi√≥n ser√° publicada en npm. Nota que no es necesario actualizar manualmente la versi√≥n en package.json, ya que el flujo de trabajo actualizar√° autom√°ticamente el n√∫mero de versi√≥n en el archivo package.json y enviar√° un commit a main.

## Licencia

[Licencia MIT](https://github.com/Flux159/mcp-chat/blob/main/LICENSE)
